description: Second-stage authentication endpoint. Takes username as URL parameter. Returns form with hidden fields containing username and user_id. Accepts POST with username, user_id, and password parameters.
notes: User ID is exposed in hidden form field on password page. The URL structure allows direct user enumeration by username. Example: /password/test reveals user_id=10032. This enables IDOR and user enumeration attacks. Endpoint accepts GET requests and returns hidden form fields containing username and user_id. POST method accepts username, user_id, and password parameters with no authentication required.
